_comment: TEMPLATE: Column Configuration - Copy this file and rename it to '[viewname]-columns.json'
_description: Define the columns displayed in your DataTable. Each column maps to a data field and configures its display, behavior, and interactivity.
_usage: Replace 'yourDataKey' with actual field names from your data source. Remove columns you don't need.

_options.data: Property name from your data object (supports nested: 'parent.child')
_options.title: Column header text displayed to users
_options.searchable: true/false - Include this column in search
_options.className: CSS classes for the column cells (e.g., 'text-center', 'fw-bold')
_options.responsivePriority: Number 1-10, lower = higher priority (1 = always visible)

_options.render: Name of custom render function from custom-handlers.js (e.g., 'renderStatusBadge', 'renderSeverityBadge', 'renderClickableCell')

_options.editable: true/false - Enable inline editing for this column
_options.editOptions: Array of {value, label} objects for select/dropdown editing
_options.editRequired: true/false - Whether the field is required when editing

_options.urlTemplate: URL pattern with {fieldName} placeholders that get replaced with actual data values

yourDataKey._comment: Hidden column (useful for data storage without display)

_options.visible: false - Hide column but keep data accessible

_availableRenderFunctions.renderClickableCell: Makes cell clickable with link (requires urlTemplate)
_availableRenderFunctions.renderProgressBar: Displays numeric values as progress bars
_availableRenderFunctions.custom: Add your own render functions in custom-handlers.js

_bestPractices: Always set responsivePriority for mobile responsiveness (1=highest priority)
Use className for consistent styling across your table
Set orderable=false for columns that don't make sense to sort
Set searchable=false for ID or action columns
Use width sparingly - let DataTables handle most column sizing
For nested data, use dot notation: 'parent.child.property'
Test your custom render functions thoroughly
Keep column count reasonable for mobile views (8-10 max recommended)
